item.title: code
item.description:
fido Bayesian multinomial logistic normal models, really fast. Lots of models including linear and non-linear regression, time-series analysis, and joint modeling of multi-omic data. renamed from stray. GitHub

RcppHungarian Header library and R functions to solve minimum cost bipartite matching problem using Huhn-Munkres algorithm. CRAN

RcppCoDA Blazing fast library for the analysis of compositional data with both C++ and R interfaces GitHub

philr Phylogenetic partitioning based ILR transform for metagenomics data. Bioconductor

driver Justin’s Personal Utilities for R. GitHub

item.title: open positions
item.description: We are currently hiring graduate students with strong mathematics and statistics backgrounds. Contact Justin Silverman if you are interested.

Study Identifies Abnormal Surge of Flu-like illness in March. (June 30, 2020). The Scientist

item.title: research
item.description:
in brief

We conduct cutting-edge research developing Bayesian statistical and machine learning methods for the analysis of various types of data including genomic, electronic health, and public health data.

Our lab is founded on collaborations with both accademia and industry, please contact us if you are interested in potential collaboration.

long form

If it has cool math and an impactful question, we are interested. Based on Dr. Silverman’s combined medical and statistical training, we tend to gravitate to problems in the analysis of biomedical data; especially, genomics and electronic health data. However, our research interests are varied and include both theoretical and applied aspects of mathematics and statistics.
